Conclusion: We should prohibit the sale of washing machines without suitable filters
Premise: washing machines without proper filters are a major source of microplastic.

Conclusion: We should take polyester and other toxic substances out of clothing and place them with natural materials
Premise: Natural materials have a large carbon footprint. They require fresh water and land, contributing to the pressure on nature and resources around the world.

Conclusion: We should use the waste from the agri-food industry in the ruminant feed chain
Premise: allow it to be handed out to charities for consumption by those in need.

Conclusion: We should teach Esperanto, a common and neutral language, at all European schools
Premise: Esperanto can be a new tool for a more united European Union.

Conclusion: We should impose an IQ test to immigrants
Premise: IQ tests do not prevent ill-intentioned people from entering our borders. Canada aims to receive 400,000 people each year, and how intelligent or skilled they are does not matter. People working in the agricultural fields are being naturalized, relatives are being naturalized.

Conclusion: We should sponsor the general population for taking in migrants
Premise: Integrating one non-western immigrant cost ca. Euro 167,000,-. Who will be paying that ?

Conclusion: We should make zero/low waste products more affordable
Premise: We should tax items based on the sustainability goals of the United Nations. This would make it possible to tax exploitation pollution of natural resources, CO2 & other greenhouse gas emissions, violation of human rights or terrible working conditions, no matter if the product is a plastic bag, an unsustainable t-shirt, a service, some food or a complex financial product.

Conclusion: We should invest in integrated photovoltaic (e.g., over agriculturally used land)
Premise: Agrivoltaic could be a perfect model for an energy cooperation of citizens to own some greenhouses with photovoltaic & rent them for a small fee to a urban gardening cooperation of citizens, for example.

Conclusion: We should reduce environment pollution by limiting number of people in Europe
Premise: Instead we need to change our behavior, reduce our consumerism and decrease our overall resource use per person.

Conclusion: We should promote a plant-based diet
Premise: In addition to this, schools and companies canteens should be required to serve mainly plant-based meals in order to reduce their impact and to educate their users.

Conclusion: We should impose an IQ test to immigrants
Premise: IQ is not an effective measure of whether they'll be economically beneficial, suited to European jobs  in high demand, likely to integrate/assimilate, their potential to cause crime etc.

Conclusion: We should impose an IQ test to immigrants
Premise: This just seems like an overtly emotional suggestion that isn't too well thought out. It would cause far more problems that it solves.

Conclusion: We should not have illegal immigrants!
Premise: We can only employ people in understaffed job fields.

Conclusion: We should strengthen Frontex and control immigration.
Premise: Frontex must be given powers and resources to shut down the migratory routes entirely.

Conclusion: We should restrict immigration.
Premise: Foreigners and immigrants must not be provided the same services and advantages as native people.

Conclusion: We should support Frontex.
Premise: Frontex is a key agency and is called to play a crucial role in the coming years. Yet, it lacks the necessary political support it deserves to carry out its mission.

Conclusion: We should support Frontex.
Premise: The EU needs a robust Frontex Agency with the caveat that Frontex missions must report to the member states on whose territories they operate.

Conclusion: We should stop immigration.
Premise: The organization of mass migration is a heinous crime. No more immigration from non-European or non-first-world countries.

Conclusion: We should make cycling and micromobility the primary modes of transport in all EU cities
Premise: Having cycling and micromobility as primary modes also makes cities quieter, less congested, less polluted, safer, and simply more pleasant and liveable, particularly for children.

Conclusion: We should strengthen the public role of faith-based communities in environmental protection
Premise: A reflection on the future of Europe needs to identify and involve other actors alongside local and international institutions to fully deploy the founding values of our continent in addressing major global challenges.

Conclusion: We should stop using GDP as the only indicator of development
Premise: It is purely economic in nature and encourages excessive production and consumption.

Conclusion: We should prevent the surveillance state
Premise: Excessive surveillance preemptively assumes everyone is a potential criminal and definitely undermines the basic human right of autonomy and self-determination.

Conclusion: We should stop Brussels from imposing ideologies, concrete policies to develop in exchange for financial aid, interference in agricultural production or legislating in judicial matters
Premise: National identities are important and have to be preserved, but nowadays these are not the key to the success. We need to be united, aligned, and, above all, independent from any extra-EU hegemon!

Conclusion: We should remove unauthorized asylum seekers and migrants
Premise: Refugees are here to seek protection and rapid repatriation when it is no longer necessary is a matter of course. When it comes to crimes, people are simply no longer worthy of protection and cannot be expelled because their actions show us that they neither accept nor respect our rules.

Conclusion: We should not have any immigration from non-European or non-first-world countries
Premise: Japan was a global superpower once just behind the USA, however, it has a strict immigration policy. Where is it now in global power rankings?

Conclusion: We should speak about the ongoing genocide in China.
Premise: The vast majority of the victims of this genocide in China are Muslims. And yet, the Muslim countries see the USA and the West as their arch-enemies!

Conclusion: We should strengthen Frontex and control immigration
Premise: Bigger financial resources for Frontex and military action in Syria will stop immigration.

Conclusion: We should rethink the legal state of Family Reunification.
Premise: The procedure of Family Reunification is already causing major problems in the USA.

Conclusion: We should restrict immigration.
Premise: Foreigners and immigrants must not be provided the same services and advantages as native people.

Conclusion: We should introduce digital identity authentication on social media that has more than 100,000 users
Premise: A good idea to end online trolls and haters. Easy to set up, it is a very good short-term solution, but fake news, unfortunately, escapes this regulation. So there is a need for other measures to attack the algorithms of the social networks themselves.

Conclusion: We should shift the EU policy toward the Russian Federation
Premise: Including Russia in our sphere of friendship would allow the EU to discuss certain values from within and coax them toward democracy and change. Economic partnerships can act as leverage. Friendly ties, in time, will bring common views to prevail.

Conclusion: We should shift the EU policy toward the Russian Federation
Premise: Pushing Russia to the wall will have adverse effects by creating a Russian-Chinese axe, detrimental to the EU. Closer economic ties allow job prospects on both sides and improve scientific research and discoveries that remain within the European continent. A partnership where both sides share and benefit from technological domains (aerospace, AI, energy, fusion, bio-chemicals, etc.).

Conclusion: We should give up developing electric vehicles
Premise: The intelligence of electric cars is much higher than that of fuel cars.

Conclusion: We should give up developing electric vehicles
Premise: Electric cars are much cheaper to use than fuel cars over the life cycle of a car.

Conclusion: We should ban the trading of virtual currencies.
Premise: Virtual currency-related business activities are illegal financial activities, and the provision of services by overseas virtual currency exchanges to Chinese residents through the Internet is also illegal financial activities.

Conclusion: We should open up three-child policy to encourage childbirth.
Premise: What people want is the right and freedom to be able to plan their own children.

Conclusion: We should ease the education involution.
Premise: The most fundamental thing is to improve the basic educational literacy of parents and advocate the educational concept of "how to be a good person is more important than success and happiness is more important than success".
